div.class: vc_general vc_cta3 vc_cta3-style-custom vc_cta3-shape-rounded vc_cta3-align-left vc_cta3-icon-size-md vc_cta3-actions-right

span.a: All District Sites Closed to the Public Until May 1, 2020

div.p: In following the updated Sacramento County Public Health Order, effective April 9, 2020, all District sites, including the Robert L. Trigg Education Center, will be closed to the public until May 1, 2020. Enrollment and other educational and business services will continue. To contact a department by email or phone, please visit EGUSD’s Division and Department’s web page. Departments will be monitoring emails and voicemails. We will respond to your request within a reasonable amount of time and we will be mindful of situations requiring deadlines. Thank you. Please stay safe and stay healthy.

div.p: EGUSD is committed to the recruitment and retention of top-notch employees with the determination and drive to create a positive and effective 21st century learning environment for our students.

div.p: The Communications Department is responsible for media, community relations and district-wide communications. The department also produces many of EGUSD’s publications, newsletters and Internet content.

div.class: vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-tabs vc_tta-color-sky vc_tta-style-modern vc_tta-shape-square vc_tta-spacing-1 vc_tta-tabs-position-top vc_tta-controls-align-left

hr.h3: Elk Grove Unified School District will provide a learning community that challenges ALL students to realize their greatest potential.

hr.p: The Elk Grove Unified School District is governed by an elected seven member Board of Education. The board members represent seven geographic areas and are elected at large for four year terms. For more information about individual board members, click on their photo.

The following are the schedules of regular EGUSD Board meetings for the 2018-19 and 2019-20 school years that were approved by the Board of Education. Meetings are held in the board room of the Robert L. Trigg Education Center – 9510 Elk Grove Florin Road, Elk Grove, CA 95624. Meetings begin at 6 p.m., unless otherwise noted, with closed sessions scheduled prior to the regular meetings as necessary.

ul.li: March 17, 2020 – Board Workshop: 3:00 – 5:00 p.m. (before the regular board meeting) – Canceled
May 5, 2020 – Virtual Board Meeting Information (Zoom Link and Public Comment Form)

p.br:
The Elk Grove Unified School District uses the Agenda Online system. This Web-based application allows you to access board meeting information including agendas, supporting documents and minutes, from any computer that has Internet access.
View EGUSD Board Meeting Agendas*

hr.p: *Please note: Finalized agendas will be available 72 hours prior to the meeting date/time.

Archived EGUSD Board Meeting Agendas
(2012 through June 2015)

p.a: Click here to view EGUSD Board Meeting Minutes page

img.br: The Elk Grove Unified School District Board Policies and Administrative Regulations can be accessed through the California School Boards Association (CSBA) system GAMUT™.

hr.p: Board Policies and Administrative Regulations can be retrieved by using the “Search GAMUT™” feature, or browsing by keyword in the “Keyword Index.” You may search by code number, policy title or specific words and phrases.

strong.a: View Elk Grove Unified School District Board Policies and Administrative Regulations

p.a: Click here to view EGUSD Board Resolutions page

hr.p: Regular Elk Grove Unified School District Board meetings are video recorded and made available on EGUSD’s YouTube Channel.

The opinions expressed by any member of the public during Board meetings do not necessarily reflect the view or opinion of members of the Elk Grove Unified School Board of Education, the District, or the District’s administrators and employees, and are solely that of the speaker. The Elk Grove Unified School District and its Board of Education hereby expressly disclaim any and all responsibility or liability for any false, defamatory, or slanderous statements expressed by any public speaker during Board meetings.

The Elk Grove Unified School District and its Board of Education are not responsible for any technical difficulties experienced by the viewer, nor is it responsible for any technical difficulties experienced in making or uploading any video recording.

Any unauthorized re-broadcasting of any video, audio or still image of Board meeting video recordings made by the Elk Grove Unified School District is strictly forbidden without advance written permission of the Elk Grove Unified School District Board of Education or its designee.

br.a: 2019-2020 Tsev Kawm Ntawv Daim Ntawv Qhia Caij Nyoog – Hmong

div.p: Note: To print EGUSD calendars on 8.5×11 paper, you will need to change your scale settings to “fit to printable area.”

hr.p: The event calendar lists upcoming district and school events that are open to the public or of interest to parents and the community.

All events are listed in calendar format on the left side and by date list on the right side. You may click on an event on the calendar which will cause the right side list to reveal the events on that specific date. Events on this calendar include Board of Education meetings, back-to-school nights, school events and awards nights. Parents will continue to be informed about events at their school through school newsletters and websites.

br.a: Traditional Calendar rau xyoo kawm ntawv 2019-2020 – Hmong
Lịch Niên Học Trường Truyền Thống 2019-2020 – Vietnamese

div.p: In Elk Grove Unified, our number one priority is to help every student learn in every classroom, in every subject, every day, and to prepare them to be college and career ready. To support that mission, the district offers several programs and services that align to four strategic goals which are centered on providing quality instruction, developing assessments and analysis for action, promoting wellness and engaging families and the community. For continuous improvement, in addition to promoting leadership development, professional learning, technology infrastructure, systems of communication, program implementation, research-based practices, and cultural competence the district takes steps to implement key initiatives to address specific needs.

ul.li: Improving Attendance and Addressing Chronic Absenteeism
Keeping Students Technically Literate Through Digital Citizenship and Internet Safety
Preparing Students For College and Career with a Graduate Profile
Recognizing the Link Between Healthy Body, Healthy Mind and Healthy Learning
Informing About Modernization and Maintenance Needs – Measure M
Helping Students Read On Grade Level
Engaging Families and the Community to Support Students

div.h3: Local Control Funding Formula (LCFF) /Local Control Accountability Plan (LCAP)
div.p: The LCFF and LCAP represent dramatic changes in the way that the State of California funds public education, and EGUSD is committed to open communication with all stakeholders to ensure that our yearly LCAP clarifies how programs and services will measurably improve in proportion to increased LCFF funding.

br.a: Elk Grove Charter School’s 2017-2020 Year 3: 2019-2020 LCAP

ul.li: Si usted necesita apoyo comprendiendo este documento, por favor llame al (916) 793-2953, extensión 67099.
Nếu bạn cần trợ giúp để hiểu tài liệu này, xin vui lòng gọi số (916) 793-2953, đường dây nối kết 67093.
Yog koj xav tau kev pab kom nkag siab thiab totaub daim ntawv, thov hu rau (916) 793-2953, extension 67101.

strong.a: EGUSD’s 2019-2020 State Report of Adopted Budget Financials

hr.h3: Visit the LCFF-LCAP page to view:

ul.li: Archived EGUSD and School Site LCAPs

img.br: Meals served at school meet state and federal requirements based on the USDA Dietary Guidelines. All meals are prepared and served by qualified child nutrition professionals. We provide students with access to a variety of fresh and appealing foods that meet the health and nutrition needs of students.

div.p: When students have eaten, they are better able to concentrate and participate in the classroom. Well nourished students make better learners.

p.a: Elementary Breakfast and Lunch Menu/Nutrition Information

hr.p: Free and Reduced Price Meals are available, under the National School Lunch Program (NSLP), to all families who believe they may qualify. There are two ways to apply.

ol.li: Complete a Free and Reduced Price Meal Application online. The online application allows you to apply online in the comfort and privacy of your home. It is convenient, safe, secure and available anytime.

Complete a paper Free and Reduced Price Meal Application form. Paper forms can be obtained at any school office within the district or at the Food & Nutrition Services office and returned to any school office, cafeteria or the Elk Grove Unified Food & Nutrition Services office at 8389 Gerber Road, Sacramento, CA 95828.

strong.a: Visit the Food and Nutrition Website to Apply – 2019-2020 Online Meal Application

hr.p:
If you have any questions about the school breakfast/lunch menus or would like more information about Free and Reduced Price Meals or the application process, please contact:
Food & Nutrition Services
(916) 686-7735
Food & Nutrition Services website

div.h3: How to Receive EGUSD Bus Route Updates:
div.p: For parents/guardians of students utilizing Elk Grove Unified School District’s bus transportation services, the following can provide information on how to receive bus updates in the event that a bus is delayed.

ol.li: Please make sure your contact information for your child/children is up to date in the District’s student information system (ParentVue/Synergy)
Parents can login or create their free SchoolMessenger account by visiting: https://go.schoolmessenger.com/#/account/login
Parents can also download the SchoolMessenger app to login and access their SchoolMessenger account.
Note: EGUSD Bus Notifications are sent as a District Message – please make sure your District Message preference allows for at least phone, email or text in order to receive bus route updates.

div.p: To see how the preference function works, you can try InfoCenter for yourself now. Visit go.schoolmessenger.com or download the InfoCenter app from iTunes or Google Play.
